item.title: Testing stimulated emission photon directions
item.description: arXiv:2409.15399v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: While naively laser only causes excitation of external target, for example STED microscopy or backward ASE in optical amplifiers, demonstrate it can also cause its deexitation, however, under uncommon condition of being prepared as excited. These two causalities are governed by absorption-stimulated emission pair of equations, and swap places in perspective of CPT symmetry, however, it means photon direction of stimulated emission should be opposite to usually assumed. This article discusses various arguments and proposes simple direct tests to experimentally verify existence of such backward photon trajectories, complementing consequent forward textbook trajectories. There are already indirect experimental arguments, like backward ASE, lack of Rabi cycle for free electron laser, or recent "negative time evidence" experiment in the news. Depending on the result: it should lead to new applications like 2WQC more symmetric quantum computers, or macroscopic violation of CPT symmetry, so far probably tested only in microscopic settings. Also proposed forward/backward/bidirectional photon sources are discussed.
